Title: 15.7.7.7 SHOW CREATE DATABASE Statement
Feature: SHOW CREATE {DATABASE | SCHEMA} [IF NOT EXISTS] db_name

mysql> SHOW CREATE DATABASE test\G
*************************** 1. row ***************************
       Database: test
Create Database: CREATE DATABASE `test` /*!40100 DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8mb4
                 COLLATE utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci */ /*!80014 DEFAULT ENCRYPTION='N' */

mysql> SHOW CREATE SCHEMA test\G
*************************** 1. row ***************************
       Database: test
Create Database: CREATE DATABASE `test` /*!40100 DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8mb4
                 COLLATE utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci */ /*!80014 DEFAULT ENCRYPTION='N' */
Description:
Shows the CREATE DATABASE
        statement that creates the named database. If the
        SHOW statement includes an IF NOT
        EXISTS clause, the output too includes such a clause.
        SHOW
        CREATE SCHEMA is a synonym for
        SHOW CREATE DATABASE.

SHOW CREATE DATABASE quotes table
        and column names according to the value of the
        sql_quote_show_create option.
        See Section 7.1.8, “Server System Variables”.
